verses.kjv: Now therefore hearken, O Israel, unto the statutes and unto the judgments, which I teach you, for to do them, that ye may live, and go in and possess the land which the LORD God of your fathers giveth you.
verses.web: Now, Israel, listen to the statutes and to the ordinances which I teach you, to do them; that you may live, and go in and possess the land which LORD, the God of your fathers, gives you.
verses.ct: "Now listen, Israel, to the laws and rules I'm teaching you. Follow them so that you may live and enter and take possession of the land that the LORD, the God of your ancestors, is giving you.

verses.kjv: Ye shall not add unto the word which I command you, neither shall ye diminish ought from it, that ye may keep the commandments of the LORD your God which I command you.
verses.web: You shall not add to the word which I command you, neither shall you take away from it, that you may keep the commandments of LORD your God which I command you.
verses.ct: Don't add anything to what I command you, and don't take anything away from it. Simply obey the commands of the LORD your God that I'm giving you.

verses.kjv: Your eyes have seen what the LORD did because of Baalpeor: for all the men that followed Baalpeor, the LORD thy God hath destroyed them from among you.
verses.web: Your eyes have seen what LORD did because of Baal Peor; for LORD your God has destroyed all the men who followed Baal Peor from among you.
verses.ct: You saw with your own eyes what the LORD did at Baal Peor — the LORD your God destroyed every person among you who followed Baal Peor.

verses.kjv: But ye that did cleave unto the LORD your God are alive every one of you this day.
verses.web: But you who were faithful to LORD your God are all alive today.
verses.ct: But all of you who held on to the LORD your God are still alive today.

verses.kjv: Behold, I have taught you statutes and judgments, even as the LORD my God commanded me, that ye should do so in the land whither ye go to possess it.
verses.web: Behold, I have taught you statutes and ordinances, even as LORD my God commanded me, that you should do so in the middle of the land where you go in to possess it.
verses.ct: Look, I've taught you laws and rules exactly as the LORD my God commanded me, so that you can follow them in the land you're about to enter and possess.

verses.kjv: Keep therefore and do them; for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the nations, which shall hear all these statutes, and say, Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.
verses.web: Keep therefore and do them; for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples who shall hear all these statutes and say, “Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.”
verses.ct: Obey them carefully, because this will show your wisdom and understanding to the other nations. When they hear about all these laws, they'll say, 'This great nation truly is a wise and understanding people.'

verses.kjv: For what nation is there so great, who hath God so nigh unto them, as the LORD our God is in all things that we call upon him for?
verses.web: For what great nation is there that has a god so near to them as LORD our God is whenever we call on him?
verses.ct: What other great nation has a god as close to them as the LORD our God is whenever we call on him?

verses.kjv: And what nation is there so great, that hath statutes and judgments so righteous as all this law, which I set before you this day?
verses.web: What great nation is there that has statutes and ordinances so righteous as all this law which I set before you today?
verses.ct: And what other great nation has laws and rules as fair and righteous as this entire set of instructions I'm placing before you today?

verses.kjv: Only take heed to thyself, and keep thy soul diligently, lest thou forget the things which thine eyes have seen, and lest they depart from thy heart all the days of thy life: but teach them thy sons, and thy sons’ sons;
verses.web: Only be careful, and keep your soul diligently, lest you forget the things which your eyes saw, and lest they depart from your heart all the days of your life; but make them known to your children and your children’s children—
verses.ct: Just be careful and guard your soul diligently, so you never forget the things you've seen with your own eyes. Don't let them fade from your heart as long as you live. Teach them to your children and your grandchildren —

verses.kjv: Specially the day that thou stoodest before the LORD thy God in Horeb, when the LORD said unto me, Gather me the people together, and I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they shall live upon the earth, and that they may teach their children.
verses.web: the day that you stood before LORD your God in Horeb, when LORD said to me, “Assemble the people to me, and I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they live on the earth, and that they may teach their children.”
verses.ct: especially about the day you stood before the LORD your God at Horeb, when the LORD told me, 'Gather the people before me so I can let them hear my words. Then they'll learn to fear me for as long as they live on the earth, and they'll teach their children to do the same.'

verses.kjv: And ye came near and stood under the mountain; and the mountain burned with fire unto the midst of heaven, with darkness, clouds, and thick darkness.
verses.web: You came near and stood under the mountain. The mountain burned with fire to the heart of the sky, with darkness, cloud, and thick darkness.
verses.ct: You came forward and stood at the base of the mountain while it blazed with fire reaching up into the heavens, wrapped in darkness, clouds, and deep blackness.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto you out of the midst of the fire: ye heard the voice of the words, but saw no similitude; only ye heard a voice.
verses.web: LORD spoke to you out of the middle of the fire: you heard the voice of words, but you saw no form; you only heard a voice.
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to you from the middle of the fire. You heard the sound of his words, but you saw no form — there was only a voice.

verses.kjv: And he declared unto you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, even ten commandments; and he wrote them upon two tables of stone.
verses.web: He declared to you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, even the ten commandments. He wrote them on two stone tablets.
verses.ct: He declared his covenant to you and commanded you to follow it — the 10 commandments. Then he wrote them on 2 stone tablets.

verses.kjv: And the LORD commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and judgments, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go over to possess it.
verses.web: LORD commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and ordinances, that you might do them in the land where you go over to possess it.
verses.ct: At that time, the LORD commanded me to teach you laws and rules so you could follow them in the land you're crossing over to possess.

verses.kjv: Take ye therefore good heed unto yourselves; for ye saw no manner of similitude on the day that the LORD spake unto you in Horeb out of the midst of the fire:
verses.web: Be very careful, for you saw no kind of form on the day that LORD spoke to you in Horeb out of the middle of the fire,
verses.ct: Be extremely careful — remember that you saw no form of any kind on the day the LORD spoke to you at Horeb from the middle of the fire.

verses.kjv: Lest ye corrupt yourselves, and make you a graven image, the similitude of any figure, the likeness of male or female,
verses.web: lest you corrupt yourselves, and make yourself a carved image in the form of any figure, the likeness of male or female,
verses.ct: Don't corrupt yourselves by making a carved image in any shape — whether in the form of a man or a woman,

verses.kjv: The likeness of any beast that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged fowl that flieth in the air,
verses.web: the likeness of any animal that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged bird that flies in the sky,
verses.ct: or any animal on the earth, or any bird that flies through the sky,

verses.kjv: The likeness of any thing that creepeth on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the waters beneath the earth:
verses.web: the likeness of anything that creeps on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the water under the earth;
verses.ct: or anything that crawls on the ground, or any fish in the waters below.

verses.kjv: And lest thou lift up thine eyes unto heaven, and when thou seest the sun, and the moon, and the stars, even all the host of heaven, shouldest be driven to worship them, and serve them, which the LORD thy God hath divided unto all nations under the whole heaven.
verses.web: and lest you lift up your eyes to the sky, and when you see the sun and the moon and the stars, even all the army of the sky, you are drawn away and worship them, and serve them, which LORD your God has allotted to all the peoples under the whole sky.
verses.ct: And when you look up at the sky and see the sun, the moon, and the stars — the entire heavenly host — don't be tempted to bow down and worship them. The LORD your God has given those to all the other nations under heaven.

verses.kjv: But the LORD hath taken you, and brought you forth out of the iron furnace, even out of Egypt, to be unto him a people of inheritance, as ye are this day.
verses.web: But LORD has taken you, and brought you out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt, to be to him a people of inheritance, as it is today.
verses.ct: But you — the LORD took you and brought you out of the iron furnace of Egypt to be his own treasured people, which is exactly what you are today.

verses.kjv: Furthermore the LORD was angry with me for your sakes, and sware that I should not go over Jordan, and that I should not go in unto that good land, which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance:
verses.web: Furthermore LORD was angry with me for your sakes, and swore that I should not go over the Jordan, and that I should not go in to that good land which LORD your God gives you for an inheritance;
verses.ct: The LORD was angry with me because of you, and he swore that I would never cross the Jordan or enter the good land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.

verses.kjv: But I must die in this land, I must not go over Jordan: but ye shall go over, and possess that good land.
verses.web: but I must die in this land. I must not go over the Jordan, but you shall go over and possess that good land.
verses.ct: I'm going to die in this land. I won't be crossing the Jordan. But you will cross over and take possession of that good land.

verses.kjv: Take heed unto yourselves, lest ye forget the covenant of the LORD your God, which he made with you, and make you a graven image, or the likeness of any thing, which the LORD thy God hath forbidden thee.
verses.web: Be careful, lest you forget the covenant of LORD your God, which he made with you, and make yourselves a carved image in the form of anything which LORD your God has forbidden you.
verses.ct: Be careful not to forget the covenant the LORD your God made with you. Don't make a carved image in the shape of anything the LORD your God has forbidden.

verses.kjv: For the LORD thy God is a consuming fire, even a jealous God.
verses.web: For LORD your God is a devouring fire, a jealous God.
verses.ct: For the LORD your God is a consuming fire — a jealous God.

verses.kjv: When thou shalt beget children, and children’s children, and ye shall have remained long in the land, and shall corrupt yourselves, and make a graven image, or the likeness of any thing, and shall do evil in the sight of the LORD thy God, to provoke him to anger:
verses.web: When you shall father children and children’s children, and you shall have been long in the land, and shall corrupt yourselves, and make a carved image in the form of anything, and shall do that which is evil in LORD your God’s sight to provoke him to anger,
verses.ct: After you've had children and grandchildren and have lived in the land a long time, if you corrupt yourselves by making a carved image of any kind and the LORD your God sees that you have done evil, provoking him to anger —

verses.kjv: I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that ye shall soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto ye go over Jordan to possess it; ye shall not prolong your days upon it, but shall utterly be destroyed.
verses.web: I call heaven and earth to witness against you today, that you will soon utterly perish from off the land which you go over the Jordan to possess it. You will not prolong your days on it, but will utterly be destroyed.
verses.ct: then I call heaven and earth as witnesses against you today: you will quickly be wiped out from the land you're crossing the Jordan to possess. You won't last long there — you will be completely destroyed.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall scatter you among the nations, and ye shall be left few in number among the heathen, whither the LORD shall lead you.
verses.web: LORD will scatter you among the peoples, and you will be left few in number among the nations where LORD will lead you away.
verses.ct: The LORD will scatter you among the nations, and only a few of you will survive among the foreign peoples where the LORD drives you.

verses.kjv: And there ye shall serve gods, the work of men’s hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.
verses.web: There you shall serve gods, the work of men’s hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.
verses.ct: There you'll serve gods made by human hands — things of wood and stone that can't see, hear, eat, or smell.

verses.kjv: But if from thence thou shalt seek the LORD thy God, thou shalt find him, if thou seek him with all thy heart and with all thy soul.
verses.web: But from there you shall seek LORD your God, and you shall find him when you search after him with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.ct: But even from there, if you search for the LORD your God, you will find him — as long as you seek him with all your heart and all your soul.

verses.kjv: When thou art in tribulation, and all these things are come upon thee, even in the latter days, if thou turn to the LORD thy God, and shalt be obedient unto his voice;
verses.web: When you are in oppression, and all these things have come on you, in the latter days you shall return to LORD your God and listen to his voice.
verses.ct: When you're in deep distress and all these things have happened to you, then in those later days you will return to the LORD your God and obey him.

verses.kjv: (For the LORD thy God is a merciful God;) he will not forsake thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant of thy fathers which he sware unto them.
verses.web: For LORD your God is a merciful God. He will not fail you nor destroy you, nor forget the covenant of your fathers which he swore to them.
verses.ct: The LORD your God is a merciful God. He won't abandon you or destroy you, and he won't forget the covenant he swore to your ancestors.

verses.kjv: For ask now of the days that are past, which were before thee, since the day that God created man upon the earth, and ask from the one side of heaven unto the other, whether there hath been any such thing as this great thing is, or hath been heard like it?
verses.web: For ask now of the days that are past, which were before you, since the day that God created man on the earth, and from the one end of the sky to the other, whether there has been anything as great as this thing is, or has been heard like it?
verses.ct: Search all of history, from the day God created people on the earth. Look from one end of the heavens to the other. Has anything this incredible ever happened? Has anyone ever heard of anything like it?

verses.kjv: Did ever people hear the voice of God speaking out of the midst of the fire, as thou hast heard, and live?
verses.web: Did a people ever hear the voice of God speaking out of the middle of the fire, as you have heard, and live?
verses.ct: Has any nation ever heard the voice of God speaking from the middle of a fire — the way you did — and survived?

verses.kjv: Or hath God assayed to go and take him a nation from the midst of another nation, by temptations, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by a stretched out arm, and by great terrors, according to all that the LORD your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
verses.web: Or has God tried to go and take a nation for himself from among another nation, by trials, by signs, by wonders, by war, by a mighty hand, by an outstretched arm, and by great terrors, according to all that LORD your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
verses.ct: Has any god ever tried to reach into one nation and pull out another nation for himself — using trials, signs, wonders, war, a mighty hand, an outstretched arm, and terrifying displays of power — the way the LORD your God did for you in Egypt, right before your eyes?

verses.kjv: Unto thee it was shewed, that thou mightest know that the LORD he is God; there is none else beside him.
verses.web: It was shown to you so that you might know that LORD is God. There is no one else besides him.
verses.ct: You were shown all of this so you would know that the LORD is God. There is no other besides him.

verses.kjv: Out of heaven he made thee to hear his voice, that he might instruct thee: and upon earth he shewed thee his great fire; and thou heardest his words out of the midst of the fire.
verses.web: Out of heaven he made you to hear his voice, that he might instruct you. On earth he made you to see his great fire; and you heard his words out of the middle of the fire.
verses.ct: From heaven he let you hear his voice to teach you. On earth he showed you his great fire, and you heard his words from the middle of the flames.

verses.kjv: And because he loved thy fathers, therefore he chose their seed after them, and brought thee out in his sight with his mighty power out of Egypt;
verses.web: Because he loved your fathers, therefore he chose their offspring after them, and brought you out with his presence, with his great power, out of Egypt;
verses.ct: Because he loved your ancestors, he chose their descendants after them. He personally brought you out of Egypt with his great power.

verses.kjv: To drive out nations from before thee greater and mightier than thou art, to bring thee in, to give thee their land for an inheritance, as it is this day.
verses.web: to drive out nations from before you greater and mightier than you, to bring you in, to give you their land for an inheritance, as it is today.
verses.ct: He drove out nations greater and stronger than you to make room for you, bringing you into their land and giving it to you as an inheritance — as it remains today.

verses.kjv: Know therefore this day, and consider it in thine heart, that the LORD he is God in heaven above, and upon the earth beneath: there is none else.
verses.web: Know therefore today, and take it to heart, that LORD himself is God in heaven above and on the earth beneath. There is no one else.
verses.ct: So understand today and take it to heart: the LORD is God in heaven above and on the earth below. There is no other.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt keep therefore his statutes, and his commandments, which I command thee this day, that it may go well with thee, and with thy children after thee, and that thou mayest prolong thy days upon the earth, which the LORD thy God giveth thee, for ever.
verses.web: You shall keep his statutes and his commandments which I command you today, that it may go well with you and with your children after you, and that you may prolong your days in the land which LORD your God gives you for all time.
verses.ct: Obey his laws and commands that I'm giving you today, so that things will go well for you and your children after you, and so you'll live long in the land the LORD your God is giving you forever."

verses.kjv: Then Moses severed three cities on this side Jordan toward the sunrising;
verses.web: Then Moses set apart three cities beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise,
verses.ct: Then Moses set apart 3 cities east of the Jordan, toward the sunrise.

verses.kjv: That the slayer might flee thither, which should kill his neighbour unawares, and hated him not in times past; and that fleeing unto one of these cities he might live:
verses.web: that the man slayer might flee there, who kills his neighbor unintentionally and didn’t hate him in time past, and that fleeing to one of these cities he might live:
verses.ct: These were places where someone who accidentally killed a neighbor — without any prior hatred toward them — could flee and find safety by reaching one of these cities.

verses.kjv: Namely, Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, of the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, of the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, of the Manassites.
verses.web: Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, for the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan for the Manassites.
verses.ct: The cities were: Bezer in the wilderness plateau for the tribe of Reuben, Ramoth in Gilead for the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan for the tribe of Manasseh.

verses.kjv: And this is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel:
verses.web: This is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel.
verses.ct: This is the law that Moses placed before the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: These are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the judgments, which Moses spake unto the children of Israel, after they came forth out of Egypt,
verses.web: These are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the ordinances which Moses spoke to the children of Israel when they came out of Egypt,
verses.ct: These are the instructions, laws, and rules that Moses gave to the people of Israel after they came out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: On this side Jordan, in the valley over against Bethpeor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel smote, after they were come forth out of Egypt:
verses.web: beyond the Jordan, in the valley opposite Beth Peor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel struck when they came out of Egypt.
verses.ct: This took place east of the Jordan, in the valley across from Beth Peor, in the territory of Sihon king of the Amorites, who ruled from Heshbon. Moses and the Israelites had defeated him after leaving Egypt.

verses.kjv: And they possessed his land, and the land of Og king of Bashan, two kings of the Amorites, which were on this side Jordan toward the sunrising;
verses.web: They took possession of his land and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise;
verses.ct: They had taken possession of his land and the land of Og king of Bashan — the 2 Amorite kings who ruled east of the Jordan toward the sunrise.

verses.kjv: From Aroer, which is by the bank of the river Arnon, even unto mount Sion, which is Hermon,
verses.web: from Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, even to Mount Sion (also called Hermon),
verses.ct: Their territory stretched from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon valley all the way to Mount Sion, which is also called Hermon.

verses.kjv: And all the plain on this side Jordan eastward, even unto the sea of the plain, under the springs of Pisgah.
verses.web: and all the Arabah beyond the Jordan eastward, even to the sea of the Arabah, under the slopes of Pisgah.
verses.ct: It included the entire plain east of the Jordan, extending to the Sea of the Arabah below the slopes of Pisgah.
